snippet: The F.B.I. investigation that toppled David H. Petraeus, the director of the C.I.A., underscores a danger that civil libertarians have long warned about.
abstract: News analysis: Federal Bureau of Investigation probe that toppled CIA director and former Gen David H Petraeus underscores a danger that civil libertarians have long warned about: that in policing the Web for crime, espionage and sabotage, government investigators will unavoidably invade the private lives of Americans; in the Petraeus case, a private cyberstalking case in which criminal charges appear unlikely, a cascade of unintended consequences has had incalculable public costs.
lead_paragraph: The F.B.I. investigation that toppled David H. Petraeus, the director of the C.I.A., underscores a danger that civil libertarians have long warned about.

headline.seo: Petraeus Case Raises Concerns About Americans’ Privacy
headline.main: Online Privacy Issue Is Also in Play in Petraeus Scandal
headline.print_headline: Petraeus Case: Issue of Privacy Is in Play, Too

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
